comments.raw_text:
In reply to / followup of Bug 549139, comment 2.

STR

1 Print something from Thunderbird (Ctrl+P)
2 While in the print dialogue, realize that you need to change or check options from page setup (orientation, scaling, margins, printing of backgrounds, inclusion of attachment list etc.)

Actual Result

User has to
i) cancel print dialogue,
ii) go to File > Page Setup, change options there, click OK
iii) then trigger print dialogue again (Ctrl+P).
This is a very inconvenient, complex workflow with multiple steps for changing even just a single option, most of which could easily be avoided with a better UI.

Expected Result

- Have a [Page Setup...] button on the print dialogue (as proposed by this RFE, see attached mockup screenshot)
-> Improved and intuitive workflow, like this:

Straight from Print dialogue (Ctrl+P),
i) click on [Page Setup...] button (as proposed in this bug), change options there, click OK to return to Print dialogue

Reasons:

1) For most, if not all of the options currently found in the "Page Setup" dialogue, the user might want to change them on a "per print" basis (orientation, scaling, margins, printing of backgrounds, inclusion of attachment list etc.)
2) Therefore, "Page Setup" dialogue should be easily accessible from the Print dialogue
3) The easiest and clutter-free way to provide that easy access is adding a "page setup" button on the print dialogue to link the two dialogues
4) We already provide similar link buttons on File > Print Preview dialogue: Both "Print" and "Page Setup" buttons are present in Print Preview.
5) Similar to this RFE, commonly used applications like MS Word and OOO Writer have an "Options..." button on their print dialogue where user can define which elements of the file he wants printed or not.
6) "absolutely necessary for the quite many sites which open a separate print page where you don't have access to the menus but only to the print dialog (possibly even opened automatically through Java Script)" (from toolkit bug 180069, comment 5.)

Related / Similar bugs

Bug 180069 (Toolkit) - Make page setup options accessible thru print dialog? [1]
Bug 423434 (Firefox) - File->Page setup is confusing, unnecessary - should be integrated in print dialog
Bug 233600 (Firefox) - Page setup should be easily accessible from the Print dialog (invalidated only for technical reasons which imo do no longer apply)

[1] The toolkit bug basically requests the same as this bug, but my impression is that toolkit bugs are somewhat orphaned / less likely to be fixed compared to mailnews:core. Plus, this bug here has much more detail, whereas the toolkit bug is currently not actionable (expected results are fuzzy).

Looking at the bug numbers, another instance of "good ideas never die"... ;)
